sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Eko-Chain moves beyond simple "track and trace" to become a computational value engine for the informal economy. We are introducing four radical innovations that currently do not exist in the Cardano ecosystem:



1. AI-Native "Proof of Pickup" (PoP): Current supply chain dApps rely on fallible human data entry. Eko-Chain integrates a custom-trained Edge AI (Computer Vision) model directly into the collector's mobile PWA.



Innovation: The app "sees" the waste. It automatically classifies material (e.g., "PET Bottle"), estimates volume, and flags contamination before the transaction is signed. This creates an objective, algorithmic "Proof of Quality" attached to the NFT metadata, reducing fraud by 90% and reducing the need for expensive human auditors.



2. Dual-Asset Tokenomics (Commodity + Credit): We are decoupling the "physical value" from the "impact value." When a verified batch is minted, the smart contract creates two distinct assets:



The Commodity Token: Represents the physical plastic. Traded locally to recyclers.



The Plastic Credit Token: Represents the environmental offset (1kg diverted ocean plastic). This is sold globally to brands for ESG reporting.



Innovation: This doubles the income for the poorest collectors, allowing them to earn from both the trash and the truth.



3. Offline-First "Optimistic" Architecture: Internet in Zaria is unstable. A standard dApp fails if the connection drops.



Innovation: We are building a "Local-First" architecture. Collectors sign transactions offline using their device's secure enclave. These are cryptographically queued and "optimistically" processed by the UI. When connectivity returns, the app batch-syncs to the Cardano blockchain in the background. This makes the UX feel instant, indistinguishable from Web2.



4. DID-Based Reputation (The Trust Score): We are moving beyond "anonymous wallets." We assign each collector a Decentralized Identifier (DID). As they successfully trade verified waste, their on-chain "Trust Score" grows. High-trust collectors eventually unlock "Auto-Verification" privileges, removing the bottleneck of human supervisors entirely.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
We will launch a Production-Grade Protocol on Mainnet that demonstrates the full "Waste-to-Wealth" lifecycle.



The Prototype will demonstrate:



AI-Assisted Minting: A user points their phone at a pile of bottles. The app's AI draws a bounding box, identifies "PET Plastic (95% Confidence)," and populates the minting form automatically.



The "Split" Transaction: A recycler buys the physical waste for 50 ADA. The smart contract automatically splits the payment: 45 ADA to the collector, 2 ADA to the verifier, and 3 ADA to the protocol treasury.



Global Plastic Credit Marketplace: A separate portal where a "Brand" (test user) can buy the "Plastic Credit" associated with that batch, retiring it on-chain to generate a "Sustainability Certificate."



Offline Sync: A demonstration of a collector logging 5 batches while in "Airplane Mode," and seeing them all sync to the blockchain automatically upon reconnection.



Access:



Live DApp: app.ekochain.xyz



AI Demo: ai.ekochain.xyz (Upload a photo to test our waste classifier).



Explorer: A custom "Impact Explorer" showing real-time map of waste collected in Zaria.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
1. Impact Metrics (The "North Star"):



Waste Diverted: 50,000kg of plastic waste verified and traded on-chain during the pilot.



Collector Income: Increase average collector earnings by 30% via the addition of Plastic Credits.



2. On-Chain Metrics:



Volume: 5,000+ Mainnet transactions (Minting, verifying, splitting, retiring credits).



Adoption: 200+ Active Wallets (Collectors & Verifiers).



Token Velocity: 50,000 ADA volume processed through the protocol contracts.



3. Technical Metrics:



AI Accuracy: Achieve >85% accuracy in material classification for the Computer Vision model.



Latency: Reduce "Time to Mint" to <5 seconds on a 3G connection (via offline signing).

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
**The Problem:** 

The circular economy is broken by an "Information Asymmetry." Brands want ethical recycled plastic but can't find it. Collectors have it but can't prove it. The current market is manual, predatory, and opaque.

No Data: 90% of African waste collection happens offline.

No Trust: Buyers discount prices because they fear contamination.

No Scale: Human verification is too slow and expensive for millions of micro-transactions.



**The Solution:**

 Eko-Chain AI Protocol We are building the Operating System for the Informal Economy.

Component 1: The "Smart" Collector App (Edge AI) A mobile app that gives superpowers to waste pickers.

AI Vision: Instantly grades waste quality.

Geo-Fencing: Validates the "Source" (e.g., proving plastic came from a specific ocean-bound zone).

Wallet Abstraction: Users log in with FaceID/Bio. Keys are managed securely; they never see a seed phrase.

Component 2: The Protocol (Aiken Smart Contracts)

CIP-68 Standards: Uses reference tokens to store mutable data (Status: Collected -> Verified -> Processed) without burning the token.

Marketplace & Escrow: A trustless exchange for trading bulk commodities.

Credit Minter: Automatically mints a fractional "Plastic Credit" for every kg of verified waste.

Component 3: The Impact Dashboard A public portal for brands and government regulators to view the real-time "Waste Map" of the city, visualizing the flow of materials from street to factory.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
1. Economic Revolution for the Bottom Billion: We are unlocking a new asset class for the poor. By tokenizing "Plastic Credits," we are essentially printing money from pollution. This puts ADA directly into the hands of the unbanked, creating a sticky, life-changing use case for Cardano in Africa.



2. Solving the "Greenwashing" Crisis: For the first time, a brand can scan a bottle of shampoo and see the exact photo of the waste picker who collected the plastic, verified by AI and timestamped on Cardano. This is the "Holy Grail" of ESG.



3. Massive Transaction Volume: This is high-velocity RealFi. A single Enactus chapter can generate more daily transactions than many DeFi protocols. Scaling this to the global Enactus network (35 countries) represents a potential 100x increase in Cardano's real-world utilization.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Based at Ahmadu Bello University in Zaria, Nigeria, our Enactus team is uniquely positioned to deliver this project.



Proven Operational Track Record: We are not an idea on paper. We are our own first customer. We already manage the real-world businesses, PUP Industries and Tompa Industries, that will serve as the pilot users for this dApp. We have existing production lines, supply chains, and a volunteer workforce.



Embedded Network: We have direct access to our target users: the collectors who supply our materials, the students who manufacture the products, and the local community who buys them. This allows for rapid prototyping and iteration.



M&E and Reporting Excellence: The Enactus model requires rigorous measurement and reporting. We are experts at tracking KPIs and documenting progress, which aligns perfectly with Project Catalyst's accountability requirements.



Steps to validate feasibility and maintain trust:



Pilot-First with Real Partners: We will begin by integrating our own ventures into the dApp, providing a real-world, low-risk environment to test every component.



Transparent Development: All code will be developed in a public GitHub repository, and we will provide bi-weekly progress updates to the Cardano community.



On-Chain Audits: The very nature of our solution means that our progress will be auditable on-chain. Anyone can track the number of NFTs minted and the volume of transactions on our platform.
